summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding travel approval requests for prosecutors and staff to conduct victim interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida and Los Angeles as part of the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). The emails detail logistical planning for flights, hotels, and conference room reservations for interviews scheduled between March and November 2019.

connections.description: Both are SDNY prosecutors/attorneys working together on the Epstein investigation, coordinating travel for victim interviews.

events.title: West Palm Beach Victim Interview
events.description: SDNY prosecutors travel to West Palm Beach, Florida to conduct a victim interview related to the Epstein investigation, requiring a hotel conference room reservation.

events.title: Los Angeles Victim Interview Trip
events.description: SDNY prosecutors plan to travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview in the Epstein investigation, tentatively scheduled for a Wednesday to Friday timeframe.

events.title: West Palm Beach Meetings and Interviews
events.description: SDNY prosecutors request travel to West Palm Beach for approximately three days for meetings and interviews with victims, noting difficulty pinning down exact timing.

events.title: West Palm Beach Travel for Epstein Case
events.description: Prosecutors request permission to travel to West Palm Beach for approximately three days for meetings and interviews related to United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Initial Florida Travel Request
events.description: Prosecutors request permission for two days of travel to West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale for meetings and interviews for the Epstein investigation.

locations: JFK (John F. Kennedy International Airport, New York)
keyFacts: The SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein is referenced by case number 2018R01618, titled 'United States v. Epstein, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.'
Prosecutors made multiple trips in 2019 to West Palm Beach, Florida and Los Angeles, California specifically to conduct victim interviews.
Travel requests consistently included booking hotel conference rooms to conduct the interviews, indicating formal, private settings for witness testimony.
The email chain shows active investigation work occurring from at least March through November 2019, involving coordination between SDNY attorneys and support staff.
The correspondence reveals standard government travel approval procedures for investigative work, with requests submitted in advance and approved by supervisors.
